content:
• Wednesday, October 31, 2012
  • AVG

    AVG Technologies (NYSE:AVG): Q3 EPS of $0.43 beats by $0.17. Revenue of $95.3M (+34% Y/Y) beats...

    AVG Technologies (NYSE:AVG): Q3 EPS of $0.43 beats by $0.17. Revenue of $95.3M (+34% Y/Y) beats by $10M. Shares +5.9% AH. (PR)

    Education Management (NASDAQ:EDMC): FQ1 EPS of -$0.04 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $609.6M (-10.6% Y/Y) misses by $5M. Shares -4.1% AH. (PR)

    AsiaInfo (NASDAQ:ASIA): Q3 EPS of $0.24 in-line. Revenue of $129.4M (+10.4% Y/Y) in-line. Shares...

    Hertz Global Holdings (NYSE:HTZ): Q3 EPS of $0.63 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $2.52B (+3.4% Y/Y)...

    Hertz Global Holdings (NYSE:HTZ): Q3 EPS of $0.63 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $2.52B (+3.4% Y/Y) misses by $70M. Shares +1.8% AH. (PR)

    Open Text (NASDAQ:OTEX): FQ1 EPS of $1.31 beats by $0.14. Revenue of $326.2M (+13.2% Y/Y) misses...

    Open Text (NASDAQ:OTEX): FQ1 EPS of $1.31 beats by $0.14. Revenue of $326.2M (+13.2% Y/Y) misses by $9M. Shares -7.3% AH. (PR)

  • BMC

    BMC Software (NASDAQ:BMC): FQ2 EPS of $0.88 in-line. Revenue of $542.8M (-1.5% Y/Y) misses by...

    BMC Software (NASDAQ:BMC): FQ2 EPS of $0.88 in-line. Revenue of $542.8M (-1.5% Y/Y) misses by $13M. The board announces new $1B share repurchase program. Shares +2.7% AH. (PR)

  • WNC

    Wabash National (NYSE:WNC): Q3 EPS of $0.30 in-line. Revenue of $405.9M (+21% Y/Y) misses by...

    Wabash National (NYSE:WNC): Q3 EPS of $0.30 in-line. Revenue of $405.9M (+21% Y/Y) misses by $27M. Shares +7.3% AH. (PR)

  • ELLI

    Ellie Mae (NYSEMKT:ELLI): Q3 EPS of $0.35 beats by $0.15. Revenue of $27.5M (+87% Y/Y) beats by...

    Ellie Mae (NYSEMKT:ELLI): Q3 EPS of $0.35 beats by $0.15. Revenue of $27.5M (+87% Y/Y) beats by $3.2M. Shares +8.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • CRUS

    Cirrus Logic (NASDAQ:CRUS): FQ2 EPS of $0.79 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $193.8M (+96% Y/Y) beats...

    Cirrus Logic (NASDAQ:CRUS): FQ2 EPS of $0.79 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $193.8M (+96% Y/Y) beats by $13M. Expects FQ3 revenue of $270M-$300M, above $237.7M consensus. Shares halted. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN -7.8%) closes with big losses. The Street is likely worried about the depressing...

    Groupon (GRPN -7.8%) closes with big losses. The Street is likely worried about the depressing performance of top rival LivingSocial, something that just forced 29% owner Amazon (AMZN -2.2%) to take a big write-down. In its Q3 10-Q, Amazon noted LivingSocial posted an operating loss of $69M in Q3 on revenue of $124M. Moreover, Amazon now gives LivingSocial a valuation of just $325M, 94% below the $5.7B valuation granted in a Dec. '11 funding round. Groupon, which reports on Nov. 8, is currently valued at $2.66B.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM | 3 Comments
  • FXEN

    FX Energy (FXEN -10.7%) says it will plug and abandon the Kutno-2 well after it flowed only salt...

    FX Energy (FXEN -10.7%) says it will plug and abandon the Kutno-2 well after it flowed only salt water. Analysts say Kutno was only one of many exploration wells that FXEN is drilling or completing currently that has meaningful upside potential to the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • ETN

    Sandy will boost demand for transformers, switching gear and other electrical equipment made by...

    Sandy will boost demand for transformers, switching gear and other electrical equipment made by Eaton (ETN +4.3%), CEO Alexander Cutler tells WSJ, as flooding and wind damage that devastated NYC and nearby areas will require replacement of electrical equipment in many buildings as well as power lines. ETN earlier said its Q3 earnings fell 5.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM | 2 Comments
  • HES

    The Hess (HES -1.8%) refinery in Port Reading, N.J., that processes 70K bbl/day of oil is still...

    The Hess (HES -1.8%) refinery in Port Reading, N.J., that processes 70K bbl/day of oil is still without power, according to a Reuters report that cites a company spokesperson. The plant was shut Monday ahead of Hurricane Sandy's arrival.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM
  • NAV

    Navistar (NAV +1.4%) says it plans to close down its truck-manufacturing operation in Garland,...

    Navistar (NAV +1.4%) says it plans to close down its truck-manufacturing operation in Garland, Texas, as it seeks to lower costs and optimize its manufacturing footprint. The facility, which has about 900 workers, is scheduled to cease operations by the first half of next year.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX +13.4%) resumes trading after a halt to reach as high as $84.50 before tripping up...

    Netflix (NFLX +13.4%) resumes trading after a halt to reach as high as $84.50 before tripping up circuit breakers once again. All the excitement is tied to a 13D filed by Carl Icahn showing a 9.98% stake in Netflix and saying the company holds "significant strategic value due its dominant market position and global growth prospects". Now the question is if Icahn still sees shares as undervalued now that they have run up a hefty gain lickety-split.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM | 23 Comments
  • TLM

    Talisman Energy (TLM -7.9%) shares are downgraded by Tudor Pickering and Scotia Capital, and...

    Talisman Energy (TLM -7.9%) shares are downgraded by Tudor Pickering and Scotia Capital, and BMO Capital cuts its price target to $15 from $18, after the company posted a surprise Q3 loss yesterday and a 23% drop in cash flow. "We will live within our means," CEO Hal Kvisle pledges. "We'll set capital spending budgets that can be funded by operating cash flows."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • CPRX

    Catalyst Pharmaceutical (CPRX -6.6%) slides after announcing a collaboration agreement with...

    Catalyst Pharmaceutical (CPRX -6.6%) slides after announcing a collaboration agreement with BioMarin Pharmaceutical (BMRN -4.5%) for the North American rights to Firdapse, a treatment of Lambert-Eaton Myasthenic Syndrome. According to the agreement, CPRX will license exclusive rights to Firdapse, while BMRN will make a $5M investment in CPRX for program advancement. Firdapse is an orphan product that has already been approved in the E.U. and is undergoing phase III clinical trials in the U.S.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM
  • NFLX

    Shares of Netflix (NFLX +11.2%) are halted after Carl Icahn reveals holding close to a 10%...

    Shares of Netflix (NFLX +11.2%) are halted after Carl Icahn reveals holding close to a 10% stake in the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM
  • PBR

    Petrobras (PBR -5.5%) shares are pummeled in the wake of late Friday's release of Q3 earnings,...

    Petrobras (PBR -5.5%) shares are pummeled in the wake of late Friday's release of Q3 earnings, which showed a 12% Y/Y drop as analysts had expected it to rise 20%. Rising costs pinched the bottom line and production has been dropping. Credit Suisse called it "the worst set of data ever seen" from PBR. "It will take a long time to turn the Petrobras ship around."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • XSPA

    More on Vringo: The federal judge overseeing the Vringo-Google case has ruled Vringo (VRNG...

    More on Vringo: The federal judge overseeing the Vringo-Google case has ruled Vringo (VRNG -42.3%) can't collect damages from Google for the 6 years preceding the filing, should the jury rule Google to be infringing Vringo's IP. The judge also shot down a Vringo request to refrain from making a final ruling on the matter until Vringo presented a rebuttal witness. (tip: SA author Modernist)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM | 18 Comments
  • EHC

    HealthSouth Corporation (HLS -5%) slides after being downgraded at JMP Securities to Market...

    HealthSouth Corporation (HLS -5%) slides after being downgraded at JMP Securities to Market Perform on valuation earlier today, citing a lack of visibility on medicaid reimbursement.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM
  • HDY

    Hyperdynamics (HDY +24.6%) shares surge based on Monday's news of an agreement with Tullow Oil...

    Hyperdynamics (HDY +24.6%) shares surge based on Monday's news of an agreement with Tullow Oil for exclusive negotiations concerning a potential acquisition of a 40% gross interest in its contract area offshore Guinea. Cash-strapped HDY has been seeking to offload part of its operated 77% stake in the concession amid drilling difficulties.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM | 2 Comments
  • MT

    Steel stocks are lower after ArcelorMittal (MT -3.8%) reported it swung to a Q3 loss and...

    Steel stocks are lower after ArcelorMittal (MT -3.8%) reported it swung to a Q3 loss and proposed a reduction to the annual dividend to $0.20 from $0.75, and U.S. Steel's (X -3.9%) weak Q4 guidance prompts Credit Suisse to cut its share price target to $20 from $24. Other steelmakers also see weakness: AKS -2.9%, RS -1.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM | 1 Comment
  • XSPA

    Vringo (VRNG -19.3%) is staring at big losses today - the company's trial against Google is now...

    Vringo (VRNG -19.3%) is staring at big losses today - the company's trial against Google is now more than two weeks old. Several execs recently sold shares as part of a pre-established Rule 10b5-1 trading plan. SA's Steve Kim, continuing his trial coverage, notes Google filed motions yesterday requesting the dismissal of Vringo's claims, and thinks a verdict could arrive "as early as Friday or Monday, or perhaps as [late] as the middle or end of next week."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM | 15 Comments
  • BCRX

    Shares of BioCryst Pharmaceuticals (BCRX -30%) react hard to yesterday's announcement, hitting...

    Shares of BioCryst Pharmaceuticals (BCRX -30%) react hard to yesterday's announcement, hitting new 52-week lows after the drug-maker withdrew its Investigational New Drug application for its antiviral nucleoside treatment for hepatitis C, BCX5191. The FDA has raised concerns related to the drug's preclinical toxicity profile at levels necessary for it to be effective.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM
  • CRNT

    Ceragon (CRNT -23.6%) is making multi-year lows after missing Q3 estimates and guiding on its...

    Ceragon (CRNT -23.6%) is making multi-year lows after missing Q3 estimates and guiding on its earnings call for Q4 revenue of $104M-$110M, below a $121.3M consensus. The mobile backhaul equipment vendor mentioned negotiations with carriers are taking longer, and 2013 budgets are receiving more scrutiny. It's launching a restructuring program it hopes will lower opex by 11%. Peers DragonWave (DRWI -2.4%) and Aviat (AVNW -2.9%) are also lower. Plenty of other names are suffering (I, II) due to weak telecom capex.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM
  • ACOR

    Acorda Therapeutics (ACOR +7.4%) trades up after its Q3 earnings beat estimates this morning....

    Acorda Therapeutics (ACOR +7.4%) trades up after its Q3 earnings beat estimates this morning. Sales of lead product Ampyra came in at $69M for the period, up 5% Y/Y, and above the Consensus expectations of $68M. The company also said that it is reaffirming its 2012 Ampyra net sales guidance of $255M - $275M.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM
  • VRSN

    Verisign (VRSN -7.1%) slides as worries mount about the Commerce and Justice departments'...

    Verisign (VRSN -7.1%) slides as worries mount about the Commerce and Justice departments' reviews of Verisign's offer for a 6-year renewal of its deal to run the registry for .com domain names. The company noted in last week's Q3 report that the Commerce department might not complete its review before the Nov. 30 expiration of Verisign's current deal, in which case a 6-month extension kicks in. Verisign's offer gives it the right to raise prices by 7% four times over the course of the deal. (2012 guidance)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM
  • RBGPF

    Midday top 10 gainers: SHF +46%. WRC +37%. OPNT-OLD +29%. RRGB +25%. MPAC-OLD +23%. RCON +23%....

    Midday top 10 gainers: SHF +46%. WRC +37%. OPNT-OLD +29%. RRGB +25%. MPAC-OLD +23%. RCON +23%. HNSN +20%. CVLT +20%. ARWR +20%. GPRE +19%. Midday top 10 Losers: IQNT -35%. OXF -31%. BCRX -29%. WU -28%. PBIB -25%. CRNT -24%. CHRM -20%. CBAK-OLD -18%. RVBD -19%. NBG -18%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 2 Comments
  • LECO

    Welding product maker Lincoln Electric (LECO +13%) gains after its Q3 EPS topped Street...

    Welding product maker Lincoln Electric (LECO +13%) gains after its Q3 EPS topped Street estimates, despite coming up short on revenue. Total profits were flat overall, but better operating profit and improved margins helped buoy its bottom line performance.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM
  • E

    Eni (E +1.6%) CEO Paolo Scaroni says he is less enthusiastic now about the Italian oil and...

    Eni (E +1.6%) CEO Paolo Scaroni says he is less enthusiastic now about the Italian oil and gas company's operations in Iraq than when it first entered the country after the end of Saddam Hussein's regime, but he rules out leaving Iraq to move to Kurdistan. Eni has invested $4B-$5B so far in its Iraqi activities out of a planned $18B.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM
  • TTWO

    Take-Two Interactive (TTWO +3.1%) rallies after beating FQ2 estimates thanks to strong sales of...

    Take-Two Interactive (TTWO +3.1%) rallies after beating FQ2 estimates thanks to strong sales of Borderlands 2, and announcing Grand Theft Auto V will arrive in spring. FQ3 guidance for revenue of $325M-$375M and EPS of $0.45-$0.60 is below a consensus of $434.1M and $0.73, but Take-Two investors, accustomed to seeing such forecasts, seem to have priced that in. Meanwhile, Electronic Arts (EA +2.5%) is trekking higher in spite of delivering poor guidance to go with an EPS beat. (EA transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM
  • QEP

    Shares of QEP Resources (QEP -6.2%) gyrate wildly but are down sharply after the...

    Shares of QEP Resources (QEP -6.2%) gyrate wildly but are down sharply after the E&P company swung to a Q3 loss as a decline in natural gas and natural gas liquids prices weighed on bottom-line results, though production increased. Earnings and revenues fell short of analysts' estimates.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM
  • QLIK

    Business intelligence software vendors continue to have a rough time: 5 days after Qlik (QLIK...

    Business intelligence software vendors continue to have a rough time: 5 days after Qlik (QLIK -0.5%) was clobbered thanks to an FQ3 miss, the same is happening to Microstrategy (MSTR -11.8%) and Actuate (BIRT -13.9%) following their Q3 misses (I, II). Actuate, which noted European sales are weak, has received a downgrade to Neutral from Roth. Are macro issues solely to blame for the misses, or is competition also a factor? SPLK -2.8%. TDC -1.1%. INFA -1.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM
  • PWR

    Quanta Services (PWR +6.5%) moves up today after its Q3 easily beat estimate. Net earnings...

    Quanta Services (PWR +6.5%) moves up today after its Q3 easily beat estimate. Net earnings surged 85% Y/Y on solid revenue gains in both its electric power and natural gas and pipeline segments. The company also raised its full-year guidance and guided its Q4 ahead of expectations. It now projects its FY12 earnings to be between $1.50 and $1.52 per share on revenue of $6.2B to $6.3B. For the current-quarter it now forecasts an EPS of $0.40 to $0.42 a share on revenue of $1.55B to $1.65B. Analysts were looking for Q4 earnings of $0.33 on revenue of $1.48B.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM
  • STX

    Seagate (STX -3.1%) falls to levels last seen in July after missing FQ1 estimates and guiding on...

    Seagate (STX -3.1%) falls to levels last seen in July after missing FQ1 estimates and guiding on its earnings call for FQ2 revenue of $3.5B, below a $3.9B consensus. The FQ1 miss occurred even though Seagate spent $669M to buy back 20.5M shares. Altogether, the company redeemed 17% of its outstanding shares in the 9 months ending Sep. 28. Seagate estimates industry hard drive shipments totaled 139M in FQ1, -11% Q/Q and -21% Y/Y. Western Digital (WDC) is nearly unchanged. (management comments - PDF) (WDC forecast: I, II)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM
  • RDC

    Rowan (NYSE:RDC): Q3 EPS of $0.21 may not be comparable to consensus estimate of $0.48. Revenue...

    Rowan (NYSE:RDC): Q3 EPS of $0.21 may not be comparable to consensus estimate of $0.48. Revenue of $354M (+50.8% Y/Y) beats by $13M. RDC says it has nine jack-ups in its active fleet with contract expirations in the next three quarters, and expects all those rigs to move to contracts at higher dayrates. Shares -3.3%. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • WWR

    Uranium Resources (URRE +6.6%) says evaluations conclude that existing Gallup, Fort Wingate,...

    Uranium Resources (URRE +6.6%) says evaluations conclude that existing Gallup, Fort Wingate, Rehoboth and Navajo Nation water wells will not be impacted by Churchrock Section 8 in-situ recovery activities, with no discernible risk of adverse effects on groundwater allocated for the Navajo-Gallup Water Supply Project.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM
  • DNKN

    Fast-food restaurant operators such as Dunkin' Brands (DNKN +0.6%), Chipotle (CMG +0.1%), and...

    Fast-food restaurant operators such as Dunkin' Brands (DNKN +0.6%), Chipotle (CMG +0.1%), and McDonald's (MCD -0.1%)) could ride out Hurricane Sandy a bit better than some of the forecasts calling for a significant drop in Q4 sales, according to analysis from Miller Tabak. Lost revenue from the past week in affected areas could be offset by evacuation route stores picking up extra traffic and relief workers coming in with few dining options. Names to watch: Ruby Tuesday (RT +1.4%) with close to 44% of its outlets in the hurricane zone, Brinker International (EAT -1.2%) at 32.6%, Panera Bread (PNRA -1.6%) with 32.6%, and Cheesecake Factor (CAKE +0.3%) sitting at 28.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM
  • WCG

    WellCare Health Plans (WCG -13%) slides after its Q3 results missed on the bottom line this...

    WellCare Health Plans (WCG -13%) slides after its Q3 results missed on the bottom line this morning. Net profit fell 57% Y/Y on weak results from its Georgia and Kentucky Medicaid programs. The company also lowered its full-year earnings estimate on the weak Kentucky results, now expecting to earn between $4.90 and $5.05 per share. Separately, it also announced plans to acquire UnitedHealthCare Group's (UNH -0.4%) South Carolina Medicaid business for an undisclosed amount.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM | 2 Comments
  • WLB

    Oxford Resource Partners (OXF -30.1%) plunges in the wake of Monday's news of a reduced Q3 cash...

    Oxford Resource Partners (OXF -30.1%) plunges in the wake of Monday's news of a reduced Q3 cash distribution of $0.20/common unit. OXF had expected to receive $10M-$15M in proceeds from the sale of excess equipment from its Illinois Basin operations but determines it is not likely to obtain acceptable value for the assets by the end of 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM | 8 Comments
  • PLCM

    Polycom (PLCM -4%) is among the day's tech losers. Possibly hurting is an IBD column noting the...

    Polycom (PLCM -4%) is among the day's tech losers. Possibly hurting is an IBD column noting the threat posed to Polycom and Cisco's (NASDAQ:CSCO) videoconferencing hardware sales by cheap cloud-based solutions that work with PCs. The article notes GoMeetNow, one prominent cloud-based rival, offers services that start at $12.95/month for two PC users. Polycom, whose sales growth has turned negative, is trying to return fire with its CloudAxis platform, which will be available in Q1.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • DIS

    Disney (DIS -2.5%) CEO Robert Iger says (video) the mega-deal to buy Lucasfilm will be slightly...

    Disney (DIS -2.5%) CEO Robert Iger says (video) the mega-deal to buy Lucasfilm will be slightly dilutive for two years after the closing and then turn accretive after that point. The exec also notes the consumer product and licensing opportunities from the transaction is close what Marvel Entertainment offered up at the point of purchase, but highlights the Lucasfilm buy includes digital properties. After a rush of gushing analysts weighed in on the deal, shares have peeled off early gains rather quickly.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM | 2 Comments
  • AAPL

    Though many pundits, analysts, and (reportedly) employees liked Apple's (AAPL -2.3%) big...

    Though many pundits, analysts, and (reportedly) employees liked Apple's (AAPL -2.3%) big management shakeup (I, II), shares have fallen below the $600 threshold today. Scott Forstall had plenty of critics, but he also earned a lot of respect on account of iOS' success over the last 5 years. Today's decline comes as Chinese regulators give their approval to iPhone 5 models meant for China Unicom (NYSE:CHU) and China Telecom's (NYSE:CHA) 3G networks.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM | 35 Comments
  • CAM

    Cameron (CAM -5.8%) shares sink despite a 36% jump in Q3 earnings and double-digit revenue gains...

    Cameron (CAM -5.8%) shares sink despite a 36% jump in Q3 earnings and double-digit revenue gains across all its segments. Although CAM says it is seeing higher demand from deepwater drillers and international markets, it issues downward Q4 EPS guidance of $0.95-$0.97 vs. $1.07 analyst consensus estimate.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • CVLT

    CommVault (CVLT +17.6%) soars to new highs after beating Q3 estimates and stating on its...

    CommVault (CVLT +17.6%) soars to new highs after beating Q3 estimates and stating on its earnings call it's comfortable with revenue growth forecasts for its fiscal year, in spite of weak IT spending. CommVault also noted $100K+ software deals grew to account for 56% of its license revenue in Q3, as it continues taking storage backup software share, and that 480 new customers were added. CommVault's partnership with Dell accounted for 21% of revenue, and IT distributor Arrow 29%. (CFO change)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM
  • GNRC

    Commercial and residential generator manufacturer Generac Holdings (GNRC +18%) doesn't...

    Commercial and residential generator manufacturer Generac Holdings (GNRC +18%) doesn't disappoint this morning, soaring on a combination of better-than-expected Q3 earnings and huge demand for its electric generators following Hurricane Sandy's blast across the Eastern Seaboard. Shares hit an-time high early in the session, driven by pent-up demand from the stock market's two-day storm closure.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • CTRP

    Ctrip (CTRP +4%) rallies following an upgrade to Buy from Goldman. Among the firm's reasons. The...

    Ctrip (CTRP +4%) rallies following an upgrade to Buy from Goldman. Among the firm's reasons. The firm thinks price competition is stabilizing, as industry subsidies decline and rival eLong sees its margins plummet. Goldman also touts Ctrip's service quality and dominant share of the business travel market, and considers Chinese online travel firms to be undervalued relative to U.S. peers on a bookings/market cap basis. Ctrip's Q3 results arrive on Nov. 5.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM
  • HNSN

    Hansen Medical (HNSN +25.5%) soars after it signs an updated license agreement with Intuitive...

    Hansen Medical (HNSN +25.5%) soars after it signs an updated license agreement with Intuitive Surgical (ISRG +0.3%) to extend ISRG's rights to Hansen Medical's patent portfolio. Under the agreement, ISRG will pay HSN a $20M up front license fee and will purchase 5,291,005 shares of its common stock for $10M through a private placement.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM
  • PSMT

    PriceSmart (PSMT +6.9%) rides its FQ4 earnings beat higher after the company grew both warehouse...

    PriceSmart (PSMT +6.9%) rides its FQ4 earnings beat higher after the company grew both warehouse club sales and membership income at a double-digit pace. The retailer says a new warehouse club in Colombia brings its total to 30 outlets.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM
  • AGNC

    In addition to solid earnings and a stock repurchase announcement, American Capital Agency (AGNC...

    In addition to solid earnings and a stock repurchase announcement, American Capital Agency (AGNC +2.5%) basks in the glow of an upgrade to Buy from Hold at Wunderlich. The entire mREIT sector is lit up bright green. MORT +1.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM | 4 Comments
  • BIDU

    Baidu (BIDU -4.1%) falls in response to the Q4 guidance and earnings call commentary...

    Baidu (BIDU -4.1%) falls in response to the Q4 guidance and earnings call commentary accompanying its Q3 beat. The fact Citi is downgrading shares all the way to Sell from Buy also isn't helping - the firm's target has been cut in half to $95. Piper's Gene Munster is taking comfort in better-than-expected customer ads, and argues Qihoo (QIHU +0.6%), the subject of much recent angst, isn't a major long-term threat. Also lower: SINA -1.8%. SOHU -1.4%. RENN -2.6%. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM
  • AGNC

    American Capital Agency (NASDAQ:AGNC) gains 2.2% following Monday's earnings release and...

    American Capital Agency (NASDAQ:AGNC) gains 2.2% following Monday's earnings release and buyback announcement. Maybe of most interest was a decline in the CPR - not squaring with either the mortgage refinance boom or other mREIT reports.
